Description: AB Volvo agreed to pay a $7 million penalty as part of an agreement with the U.S. Department of Justice regarding charges brought in connection with an ongoing investigation related to the United Nations Oil for Food program. The agreement came as the Justice Department filed criminal informations against AB Volvo subsidiaries Renault Trucks SAS and Volvo Construction Equipment AB charging that they engaged in separate conspiracies to commit wire fraud and to violate the books and records provisions of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2008/March/08_crm_220.html

Description: In a settlement with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Mack Trucks Inc. has agreed to properly manage the hazardous waste at its truck assembly plant in Macungie, Pa.  Mack Truck, located at 7000 Alburtis Road, Macungie, Pa., has also agreed to pay a $54,800 penalty to settle the alleged violations of hazardous waste regulations.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/33f558fa4d06ad8b85257d8f00585988.html

Company: Prevost, a division of Volvo Group Canada, Inc; Volvo Industrial de Mexico S.A. de C.V.; and Prevost Car (US) Inc.
Description: Untimely recalls from 2009-2013, and untimely submission of EWR reports and TSBs. 49 USC 30118(c), 30119(c), 49 U.S.C. 30165(a)(3), and 30166; 49 CFR  573.6, 579.5, 579.22, 579.28. Penalties to be paid in six annual installments.
Info Source: https://www.nhtsa.gov/laws-regulations/civil-penalty-settlement-amounts

Description: Volvo agreed to settle allegations that from 1999 through 2003 two of its subsidiaries and their agents and distributors made approximately $6 million in kickback payments and authorized additional payments of about $2 in connection with their sales of humanitarian goods to Iraq under the United Nations Oil for Food Program.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/litigation/litreleases/2008/lr20504.htm

Company: Volvo Construction Equipment North America, Inc.
Info Source: https://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/OFAC-Enforcement/Documents/05292009.pdf

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 333924: Industrial Truck, Tractor, Trailer, and Stacker Machinery Manufacturing
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
